meaningMnemonic: The kanji and the word are exactly the same. That means they share meanings as well, at least on the <kanji>tendon</kanji> side of things.
readingMnemonic:
Since this word is made up of a single kanji, it probably uses the kun'yomi reading. You did not learn this reading, so here's a mnemonic to help you: 

You get a horrible <vocabulary>tendon</vocabulary> injury, making it so you can't walk anymore. You're so upset that you blame it on Jesus. So, you go and <reading>sue Je</reading>sus for this tendon injury, and win in court, amazingly.
